p.strong: UPDATE: MEAL SERVICE INFORMATION, AS OF APRIL 20, 2020

p.em: As of Monday, April 20 there will be some changes to our meal services:

li.em: Augusta Ranch Elementary will be closed and the drive-thru and meal service will move to Desert Ridge Junior High
There will be just one pick up required per day to collect both breakfast and lunch
New meal service opening hours are Mon- Fri 8 am-10:30 am

a.title: Go to comments for Free Pick-Up Meal Services Information

p.strong: UPDATE: PARENT TECH SUPPORT SERVICES, AS OF APRIL 20, 2020

span.p: We continue to provide tech support for our parents, over the phone, and through our drive-thru service at GPS Technology. For full details, please visit ourParent Technology Support Website.
As of Monday, April 20 there will be some small changes to our opening times, please see below:

a.title: Go to comments for Update on Parent Tech Support April 17

strong.a: Connect, Create, Care - Gilbert Public Schools Family Newsletter

a.title: Go to comments for Connect Create Care Newsletter April 17

span.p: We have compiled a wide range of free enrichment learning resources for all grade levels.

Please note these are activities and materials for students and parents to support ongoing learning during the current school closures.These do not replace curriculum, and completion of any of these activities is not required and will not count towards any credits or grades.
If the school closures last for an extended period of time we will update our community regarding longer-term online learning opportunities.

a.title: Go to comments for Enrichment Resources for Families

strong.span: COVID-19 - Important Health and Safety Information for Gilbert Public Schools Community

strong.a: CDC: Frequently Asked Questions COVID-19 and Children

li.strong: Connect, Create, Care - Gilbert Public Schools Family NewsletterApril 9,2020
Connect, Create, Care - Gilbert Public Schools Family NewsletterApril 3, 2020
Maricopa County Public Health Coronavirus Letter to Parents (English pdf |Spanish pdf)

a.title: Go to comments for Corona Virus Letter

span.p: MARCH 15, 2020 - Governor Doug Ducey And Superintendent Kathy Hoffman Announces Closure Of Arizona Schools To Address Staffing Shortages And Prioritize Arizona Children

strong.a: LINK TO LETTER FROM GOVERNOR DUCEY AND SUPERINTENDENT HOFFMAN

a.title: Go to comments for Governor Ducey's Announcement

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.a: Please click here to view details of our Emergency Workers Child Care for children aged 3 - 12, offered at Spectrum Elementary and Superstition Springs Elementary.

p.span: On March 30, 2020Governor Doug Ducey and Superintendent of Public Instruction Kathy Hoffman announced the closure of all schools, statewide, until the end of the school year.
We are grateful for the ongoing support and patience of our GPS staff and community as we work to make decisions that are best for our students, staff and families.
As a district, our top priority continues to be the health and safety of our students, staff, and families.

h1.aria-label: What is happening with Dual Credit?
h1.span: What is happening with Dual Credit?

p.span: Our GPS remote learning plan will be used for dual enrollment courses. Students will be required to successfully complete fourth quarter assignments to ensure that all college course competencies have been met. If students do not have access to the internet, an alternative plan to access materials could be made. Students should reach out directly to their teachers with any questions.

h1.aria-label: Any resources on how to talk with children about COVID-19?
h1.span: Any resources on how to talk with children about COVID-19?

div.p: NASP Talking to Children about COVID-19- Parent Handout
SAMHSA Talking with Children - Parent Handout

h1.aria-label: Can I pick up my student's medication and personal belongings from school?
h1.span: Can I pick up my student's medication and personal belongings from school?

div.p: Yes, all school campuses were open Tuesday, March 17 and Wednesday, March 18 for parents or guardians to pick up any needed student medications, musical instruments, or personal belongings that are at the school.Going forward please reach out directly to your school campus with questions.

p.span: As we now know that school buildings will be closed until the end of the school year your school campus will contact you with information on picking up personal belongings.
If you feel something is essential, please contact your childs school directly. Visit your schools website Contact Us page for details on how to contact your school.

div.p: Details of GPS pick-up meal services are below, also please click here for a list of other East Valley food resources.

h1.aria-label: What is happening with Summer School?
h1.span: What is happening with Summer School?

p.span: As of March 31, summer school will continue as planned. Registration is already open for secondary summer school, and registration for elementary summer school opens Thursday, April 2nd. More information can be found on our district website, links below:

h1.aria-label: Where do I find Global Academy updates?
h1.span: Where do I find Global Academy updates?

div.p: Please visithttps://www.gilbertschools.net/Page/1963for updates related to Global Academy.

p.span: Our goal as a district is to continue to support the education of our students, while working within the constraints of the current circumstances, and adhering to the guidance of state and national agencies.

By now your student's teacher will have reached out to your student to begin remote learning. If you have not heard from a teacher please reach out directly to them. You can find teacher contact details on teacher websites on school websites, under the staff directory.
Parents can also find a wide range of enrichment learning resources, K-12, at
Please also visit www.gilbertschools.net/remotelearning for parent resources.

Special Education teachers and related services staff are providing remote learning experiences based on special education goals and accommodations through a variety of modalities, including Google Classroom, individual conversations with families, and WebEx meetings. Some students are utilizing online learning, while others are being provided with hands-on remote learning materials. In many cases, special education staff is collaborating with general education teachers to maximize learning related to grade level standards and materials.

Our Special Education team will be in contact with families to reschedule meetings. The District is currently investigating possible long term options for remote learning and services for our special education students appropriate beyond the initial closure period.
All preschool screenings are canceled and will be rescheduled for a time after school resumes.

div.p: Due to the COVID-19 events and school closures, Gifted Testing Requests have been suspended until July 15, 2020. Because of Gilbert Public Schools' protocol of administering Gifted Testing and Screening only to enrolled students, any requests for testing made on or after July 15th will be evaluated and, if approved, scheduled for on enrolled campus testing beginning Monday, August 24, 2020. As always, the student's enrolled campus will schedule and communicate specific Gifted Testing dates. For any families who had made a Gifted Testing Request PRIOR to the COVID-19 school closures, those requests have already been evaluated and have been forwarded to your students' enrolled campus for consideration of test administration beginning August 24, 2020.

As a reminder, Blanket Gifted Screening will be administered to all enrolled 3rd graders in October 2020 and all enrolled 5th graders in February 2021. Unless your student is enrolled at Neely Traditional Academy, this campus will administer Blanket Gifted Screening to all enrolled 3rd graders in October 2020 and all enrolled 1st graders in February 2021.

h1.aria-label: AP Advanced Placement - Updates from College Board
h1.span: AP Advanced Placement - Updates from College Board

h2.span: AP Testing: What Students Should Know and Do

ul.li: AP Exams have been revised to about 45 minutes each and will be taken online, at home.
AP Exams are scheduled for May 11-22, with make-up testing on June 1-5

This years exams focus on content most teachers covered prior to March. So this years exams have been designed to honor and
reward the good work students already did prior to widespread school closures.

Colleges across the country are voicing strong support for students to complete the AP experience, take the exam, and receive the
college credit they deserve. Colleges are especially supportive given the uncertain financial future many families face, and the value of students entering college with credit.
Depending on a schools exam-taking policy, a student can opt-out of the exam if they prefer not to test this year; there will not be a $40 cancellation fee.
Students who need help with access to a device or internetplease visit http://cb.org/tech.

On AP Central, students can see course-specific exam information, including exam dates and times, descriptions of what theyll be
asked to do on their exam, and more; exam features; exam scoring; and exam security.
On YouTube, students can access daily, online AP classes and review at https://youtube.com/advancedplacement

Students can log into their MyAP account to get practice tests, activities & resources for the various AP classes they are taking.
https://apcentral.collegeboard.org/

p.b: Administered at Highland High School to Pre-AP Enrolled Freshman

p.span: Original Test Date: April 28

div.p: Due to the extended school closures, Highland High School-based test administration for its Pre-AP students has been canceled. Gilbert Public Schools continues to monitor the coronavirus (COVID-19) situation closely and will update this information as necessary.

p.b: Various Sites around East Valley and State of Arizona

p.span: Original Makeup Date: March 28
Original Test Date: May 2
Original Test Date: June 6
Currently still scheduled to occur

div.p: March and May national testing dates have been canceled due to the rapidly evolving situation around the coronavirus (COVID-19). Students who have already registered for the May 2 administration date or were scheduled for the March 28 make update will receive refunds. Additional information will be shared with students directly from the College Board.

br.span: For more specific information regarding national SAT test administration, students and families may visit
for the most up to date communications.

p.b: Administered on Each High School Campus

p.span: Original Test Date: March 24

div.p: The Arizona Department of Education is working with vendors to extend the state testing window. The ADE is also currently engaging with the federal government in the event it is decided that state testing needs to be suspended for the 2019-2020 school year. Additional guidance will be provided in the coming days and weeks as more information is made available.

p.b: Various Sites around East Valley and State of Arizona

p.span: Original Test Date: April 4

p.strong: Rescheduled Test Date: June 13 or July 18

div.p: As a safety precaution, ACT has rescheduled its April testing date to June 13. All students who had registered for the April 4 administration date will receive email communication directly from ACT informing them of the postponement and instructions for free rescheduling to the June 13 or July 18 national testing dates.

p.strong: For more specific information regarding national ACT test administration, students and families may visit ACT.org for the most up to date communications.

strong.a: The ACT Test: Student and Parent Resources

div.h1: Keep Your Student's Emergency Contacts Updated

h2.span: In order to ensure that we can communicate withfamilies regarding their student, or in case of an emergency, it is essential that families keep theiremergency contact information up to date intheirInfiniteCampus account.

span.p: The Gilbert Public School Districts Safety and Security Department is committed to providing a safe learning and working environment for all students, faculty, staff, and visitors. The Security Department is also tasked with protecting the districts assets, as well as developing and implementing new innovative safety and security related protocols.
